column1: over the wicket, back of a length at off stump, defended to the covers
touch fuller, at middle and leg, clipped firmly to mid-on
good length, full at off stump, defended on the front foot to mid-on
back of a length outside off, punched back down the pitch...no width offered

cleaned him up! That's superb bowling. Pitches it up at off stump, hint of shape back into the left hander, he goes for a drive and it sneaks back between bat and pad. Took a bit of inside edge on the way
and he starts with a wicket maiden, this is back of a length at off stump, played to square leg off a thickish inside edge
good start! Finds the outside edge first ball, falls well short of slip, full and swinging back at the batsman who pushes hard
that's a better stroke, gets solidly onto the front foot and punches a full delivery firmly to mid-on
back of a length, forced into midwicket off the back foot
full at the stumps, pushed to mid-on
touch more on the pads but he can't take advantage as he turns it to midwicket
full at off stump, onto the front foot and drives to mid-off
tucks a straight delivery off the pads to deep square leg
full at the stumps, just that hint of movement back, driven to mid-off. A challenging length
angled across outside off, left alone
that's a loose shot! Very good bowling, though, as he pushes this across wider, doesn't shape back, Haris goes after it with a big drive
that's a good shot, closer to off stump, good length, punches it firmly through the covers
that's even better! Times this perfectly straight of mid-off as he eases forward into a full delivery on off stump. Elegant. A man in form
good length at off stump, punched into the pitch and it bounces back to NCN
that's pushed wide outside off, left alone, and called wide...the bowler not happy
full outside off, driven to mid-off without much timing
straight down the ground! Now it's Masood's turn as he comes forward and punches this straight of mid-off
loses his line down the leg side
back outside off, angled into the gully area with an open face where Handscomb makes a good save
wrong line, short of a length on the pads, timely very nicely backward of square with a strong flick
gets away with a bottom edge as he shapes to cut, bounces down into the popping crease and back towards Carey. Not the best over you'll see from Coulter-Nile
length ball, pushed to mid-off
pulls the length back a touch, on off stump, played back down the pitch
short of a length outside off, he's onto the back foot and plays to mid-off
nicely whipped from around middle and leg, beats midwicket inside the circle
a short ball, pitches outside leg stump, Haris ducks underneath
another cracking straight drive! Perhaps the best of the day so far. Wasn't a half volley, he punched it on the up perfectly straight back past the stumps
very full, wide outside off, driven square through the off side...been some poor stuff from NCN
comes round the wicket, doesn't make a difference, it's short and wide outside off, cracked square through point with a horizontal bat
that's out of the middle of the bat as well, coming forward to another drive on the up but finds mid-off
bangs in a short delivery, pulled backward of square
back over the wicket, full outside off, might have been a slower ball, mistimed to the on side
back of a length outside off, played with a slightly open face into point
popped up to midwicket! Back of a length at leg stump, Masood looking to flick it through the leg side but it comes off the leading edge and provides a simple chance
dropped in short and pulled firmly to midwicket
back of a length at off stump, defended back to the bowler
another short ball, pulled just short of square leg! He's keen to take on the short ball, connected nicely but was only a meter in front of Khawaja
short of a length outside off, defended towards backward point
angled into the pads, length delivery, worked to square leg. Another wicket maiden for Richardson
over the wicket, works a back-of-a-length delivery into the on side
full and straight, worked towards mid-on...Rizwan was racing off for the run but he was sent backfull out
full outside off, he's off the mark with a firmly punched drive through the covers
that's a superb stroke down the ground, we've seen a few of those already, nicely through the line of a straight half volley
drags the length back, on off stump, defended to point
full at the stumps again, another firm on-drive but finds mid-on this time
good length at the stumps, driven straight but mid-off is able to get across
a slower ball, much fuller, Haris spots it and defends towards mid-off
good length, straight, gets forward and defends
back of a length at off stump, punched firmly to cover
another slower ball, full at middle and leg, pushed to mid-on
back of a length, whipped through midwicket with plenty of bottom hand
round the wicket, full at middle, clipped into midwicket
outside off, he gets well forward and flicks to the leg side
touch shorter and straight, worked to midwicket
angled in at leg stump, he goes onto the back foot and plays with a straight bat to deep midwicket
full at middle and off, driven to cover
that's a terrific shot, superb footwork as he skips down on a leg-stump line, gives himself room and drives inside-out over cover
back of a length at off stump, pushed to midwicket
fuller, finds midwicket again
that's a bit of a long hop, dragged down short, Rizwan pulls powerfully through square leg
full at the stumps, squeezed into midwicket

short again, outside off, hammered through midwicket and Richardson is in some trouble in the deep. He's signalled to the dressing room straightaway. Pulled out a massive dive, landed heavily on his bowling arm - the elbow digging into the turf
back of a length outside off, played to deep cover
skips down the pitch and clips to long-on
fraction short outside off, very nicely played through point with a square drive
driven to deep cover
short outside off, onto the back foot and pushed to long-on
driven square to point
flicked from off stump into midwicket
over the wicket, full at straight, driven to mid-off
flicks a full delivery to long-on
goes down very early to sweep this, a straight delivery which wasn't that full, sends it to deep square
full at the stumps, driven back to the bowler who gets a hand on it
shorter delivery, slides on, he's on the back foot and drives to deep cover
full outside off, driven to deep cover
short of a length outside off, pushed to deep cover
round the wicket, works a straight delivery to deep midwicket
worked off the stumps behind square on the leg side
uses his feet, doesn't quite to the pitch but eases it along the ground through the covers
good length outside off, tapped into the off side and it's racing off again for the run. Sent back.
short outside off, leans back towards leg and places it to deep cover
comes down the pitch but it's a back-of-a-length delivery and he ends up padding it away
defended to the off side
plays a strong sweep, takes it from around off stump and sends it through square leg
touch too short outside off, driven from the back foot to deep cover
left alone outside off
full at leg stump, clipped off the toes to deep square leg
round the wicket, full at the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
worked off the stumps through midwicket
short outside off, isn't costly as he drives to cover
length outside off, left alone
short outside off, clubbed down to long-on...tried to hit that too hard
full at off stump, tapped carefully back to Finch who sneaks through the over for just two runs. That's a real bonus
legbreak, and it sits up outside off to be pushed firmly to point
floated up much fuller this time, and Rizwan digs it out back to him
Rizwan backs away, exposing his stumps, and chops a straight one off the stumps and out through cover point
a wristy flick threads the gap wide of midwicket, and that's the fifty stand
eased down to long off, one more
generous flight on this googly to end the over, Haris reading it and stepping forward to defend
pushed through the off side field for a single
tucked into the leg side, and he can't find space

got him! Australia are missing Richardson, but Finch has broken through for them with a golden left arm. He flights one up outside off, Haris pushing lazily inside the line at it as the ball rushes on with the arm and a thin edge being safely pouched by Carey. A third ODI wicket for Finch!
he's off the mark straight away, pushing down the ground
placed through mid off to turn the strike back over
quicker one from Finch, a little darter that beats a flick and pings the pad - well outside leg
Rizwan hops back to punch a legbreak out to the sweeper
thrashed square! Zampa tempted the shot with a very full, very wide googly and Umar launches into a scything drive through point
nice and full, but straighter and it's pushed back to the bowler
Umar leans forward watchfully, presenting the full face in defence
nice line from Zampa, and a little quicker on off stump, but it's easily kept out
googly, and it's a good one, but Umar reads it and taps a single through cover
floated up by Finch, Umar looks for a tip-and-run single to cover but the fielder's too sharp
nicely bowled, outside off, and Lyon puts in a dive at cover point to stop Umar's push
chopped into the covers, once again Lyon stops it
Umar stays deep and wrists a straight one into the leg side this time, a single to mid on
Finch loops one too far down the leg side and he's punished by Rizwan, who bends low into a well-placed sweep and raises the hundred in the process
Rizwan steps back to punch a quicker one back at Finch
sharp turn into him, but it's much too short and Umar sets himself for a big pull. But he doesn't get all of it, and it's just a single to midwicket
punched down the ground to long on, playing with the spin
lovely little late cut from Umar, who waits and waits and then dabs it fine, but the boundary is saved by a diving Shaun Marsh and they're kept to two
no stopping this one! Too short, too wide, and Umar spanks a cut through point
straighter this time, and it's pushed back to the bowler
another pull, but it's inside edged into the leg side so just the one
flighted up on middle and leg by Finch, and it's dug out to long on
flatter, on off stump, and it's tapped back at him
Rizwan sweeps one handed, the ball dribbles to leg and Umar wants a single, but he's sent back
pushed out through cover for a single
nicely straight from Finch, and Umar can't do anything with it
a hint of width outside off, but Umar's chop goes straight to cover
glanced with the spin past short fine
Umar slices a good-looking cut, but it's smartly stopped at point

Umar holes out! He kept trying to attack the midwicket boundary in Lyon's last over, and that tactic has brought his downfall now. Umar hops back and pulls the ball high towards midwicket, but the connection's not good enough to get it past Handscomb in the deep
pressed watchfully back to the bowler
Shoaib looks for a late cut, but finds short third man
a touch of spin for Lyon, but the batsman works with it to find a single into the leg side
generous flight from Finch, Malik has a good look and taps it back to him
Malik hangs back, nudging a run through mid on
floated up nice and high on off stump, Rizwan leaning forward to defend
looped down at 75km/h by Finch, and Rizwan rather over-eggs his sweep, inside edging onto his pad
punched through mid off for one
quicker one from Finch, and it's punched to point
nurdled close in on the leg side, but Malik's call comes straight away and they pinch a quick single before Carey can get to it
Lyon stays around the stumps, Malik dabbing a late cut fine of short third
walloped over wide long off! Malik hops out into an inside-out drive, staying inside the line and holding his shape. Nicely played, first six of the innings
quicker, and Malik turns the strike over with a single into the leg side
was this edged? The umpire signals byes. Rizwan backed away at one that went on with the arm but missed it, and so did the keeper
speared down at 92km/h, and he finds a single through square leg
flighted outside off at just more than 79km/h, Malik defending to point
Malik looks to place a drive through cover, but can't beat the field
a floater on off stump is tapped back to him
a backfoot punch brings a single to long on
Rizwan flicks firmly back at Finch, who stumbles into Malik as he tries to stop it. No hard feelings
a drive out to the cover sweeper keeps Rizwan on strike
skidding into the pads, and Rizwan glances behind square
nicely bowled, a legbreak full on an off stump line, but Malik meets it with a neat drive to long off
slider, into the stumps and Rizwan hurries a jab to keep it out
full, on middle and leg, and it's dug out back to the bowler. That's the 90th dot ball of the innings
and that's the 16th boundary! Rizwan bends low into a powerful sweep, placing it well
a front foot pull sends the ball bouncing out to deep midwicket, and takes Rizwan to fifty - his 4th in ODIs
Rizwan nails another sweep, but it goes along the ground and straight to the man at deep backward square
punched through mid on for one
huge flight from Finch, and Rizwan can only dig it out back to him
Rizwan hops back at a very tame long-hop outside off, but he chops straight to cover
a sliced cut isn't stopped cleanly at point by Lyon, and they take a single
flicked off the toes for one
misfield in the deep after Malik backs away at a nippy wrong 'un and punches out through cover. Coulter-Nile almost over-runs it, but recovers to save the boundary
pushed down to long off for a single
nicely bowled, spinning away outside off, and a soft drive is easily intercepted at cover
another googly, but it's read and pushed to long on
flighted up outside off, and Rizwan meets it with a fluid drive that bounces out to the sweeper
lovely placement from Malik, who hangs back on bended knee and places a backfoot punch to the right of point to pick up his first four
Rizwan steps into drive down to long off
Finch nudges 77km/h and Malik gets back and across, working across his pads for a single
chopped straight to cover
a touch quicker at 79.7km/h, but again Rizwan pings the cover field
fuller this time, and he drives out to the sweeper
pressed through mid on, one more
Malik flicks the returning Coulter-Nile off his pads, and hard running brings two
on a length and nicely straight at 132km/h, Malik defending from the crease
punched firmly off the back foot, in front of square and out to the sweeper
rising outside off stump, Rizwan hopping to chop it through gully
Malik aims for a straight drive, but can't time the stroke
Malik walks across to off but Coulter-Nile follows him and a flick is stopped at midwicket
massive flight from Finch, the ball eventually getting through at just 75km/h, and it's driven to long off
placed through cover, just the one
Rizwan stays deep and finds a gap at extra cover
a committed dive from Maxwell at cover stops Malik's punch
this time he finds the gap, and it's a single out to the sweeper, raising the fifty stand
Rizwan lunges forward to get to the pitch, threading the gap at cover
full and straight, pushed back at him
laced through point! Rizwan is up on his tippy toes, getting on top of a rising ball and thrashing a cut through the gap
a wristy flick fetches an off stump delivery into the leg side, turning the strike over
fuller this time, and Malik can't get his drive past the bowler
offcutter, outside off, and he waits on it before dabbing to third man
a punchy drive goes to mid on, but he's deep and they take him on for a single
is it one too many? Rizwan bends low and slogs a sweep wide of midwicket
and now he's swept! Finch had only conceded a single boundary before these two deliveries. Rizwan gets very low once again, and this time he rolls his wrists and places a sweep fine
a touch too short, and Rizwan pulls meatily off the front foot to go to his highest score in ODIs
worked off the pads for a quick single
speared in flatter by Finch, and Malik nurdles to leg
generous flight to end the over, and Finch's spell, and he dives to stop a drive back to him to end it with a dot - but it's still 12 off the over
too straight, Malik glancing off his pads for a single
Rizwan skips out and goes inside-out over cover, but the shot is stopped in the deep
googly, Malik hanging back and placing it through point
Rizwan dabs a late cut to short third man, and there's just enough time for a single. Couldn't quite get it fine enough
Malik comes forward, driving out to the sweeper
swept fine, but the fielder's around in a flash and it's just a single
Maxwell comes around the stumps, and Rizwan greets him with a Maxwell-esque shot, bending right down onto his knee and dabbing an unorthordox late cut fine
punched out to long off for one
worked into the leg side, with the spin
Maxwell gets across quickly to his right to cut off a drive down the ground
whipped to leg, but he can't beat midwicket
and now he's forward to drive, Lyon diving over one at cover to allow a single
flighted outside off, and he's on the drive down to long off
Malik is on the front foot to place a drive through cover, and this stand is into the 80s
googly from Zampa, and italmost sneaks through as Rizwan hangs back and looks for a cut
a drive finds the cover sweeper for a single
eased down to long off, one more
a front foot dab goes straight to point
round the wicket, gets a leading edge which pops back down the pitch as he aims to leg
short and wide outside off, well placed backward of point for a boundary to bring up 200
back on the stumps, flicked down to long-on
short outside off, steps back but cracks his drive to cover
another leading edge, looking to turn a full delivery at off stump to the leg side and it runs to long-off
flicked back to the bowler. Maxwell hustles through another
full outside off, punched firmly back at the bowler
full, at the stumps, flicked backward of square to long leg
low full toss outside off, bunted down the ground to long-on
that's a wild shot, charges down the pitch and has a big heave to the leg side, the ball scoots between bat and pad
full and straight, pushed down to long-on
full at off stump, Stoinis gets across in his followthrough to cut it off
over the wicket, flicked from off stump down the ground
flicks a straight delivery to the man at midwicket
on the pads, tucks it wide enough of midwicket for the single
full outside off, draws him forward and he dabs into backward point
flatter, shorter, worked off the pads to deep square but just another single
a shorter delivery, sticks in the pitch a little, worked down to long-on. Binary batting
slips down the leg side
length ball outside off, pushed to long-on
a bouncer, he ducks underneath...could probably have taken that on
another short ball, on leg stump, this time he pulls down to long leg
back of a length, straight, tucked through midwicket and a good piece of running to break the singles
drives through a length delivery outside off but clunks it to cover
beaten! Back of a length, just outside off, scoots through past off stump...perhaps kept a touch low, Rizwan was on the back foot
tucks a length delivery behind square on the leg side
gets across the stumps and nudges to the leg side
straight delivery, tucked to deep square leg and that's fifty for the captain
milking singles on the leg side, but Australia will be happy with this
steps back outside leg and places this square through the off side, wide of the sweeper
gets away with a short ball, dragged down on leg stump, Malik pulls but picks out short fine leg
over the wicket, full and straight, pushed back to the bowler
outside off, short of a length, cuts square through the off side and that takes him to 99
short of a length, fired in at leg stump, can't whip this away
there it is! A maiden ODI hundred for Rizwan as he sweeps this off the stumps to deep square. The promotion has worked a treat.
dropped at long-on by Maxwell! Malik used his feet, clubbed this straight of long-on, so Maxwell had to make some ground, it was a low chance and he couldn't hold on
now the shots are coming, aims this down the ground again and gets an inside edge to the leg side
full and straight, flicked to midwicket and it's left through for a single. Maxwell again!
this turns quite a lot from outside off, dabbed into the covers
pushes a straight delivery through straight midwicket, long-on prevents the second
an appeal for lbw as he goes for the sweep, no one is that interested
moves outside leg stump very early, gave Lyon an early look at all three, then an inside edge skews down to fine leg with a wild throw allowing an extra run
swept to deep backward square
comes down the pitch, it's a quicker delivery, flat-batted to deep cover
plays forward and drives into the covers
comes down the pitch and drives powerfully just out of the reach of Zampa to his left
finds long-on and Maxwell is safe this time! Has a smile about it. Malik came down the pitch, the ball was full outside leg stump, couldn't get the leverage he needed and it went straight to Maxwell
full at straight, defended
tossed up on off stump, driven into the covers. Tidy finish for Zampa
turns from outside off into the stumps, pushed to the covers. Rizwan pulls out the dive
round the wicket, paddle sweeps from outside off to deep square leg
appeal for lbw as he misses a sweep, Dharmasena says not out
full at off stump, pushed to cover
just over slip! He brings out the reverse sweep, goes much finer than he wanted, slip leaps in the air but can't quite get there
well bowled, that's a lovely delivery, squares up Faheem and takes a thick outside edge to short third man...slip had been brought out, that may have been a catch
moving all over the crease then scoops this over the keeper, his first boundary for 43 balls and it's a cheeky one
that's hit powerfully! Comes down the pitch and swings across the line at a back-of-a-length delivery, beats deep midwicket who didn't pick it up straightaway
moves outside leg stump to give himself room, it's full at the stumps, driven to mid-off

brilliantly done by Maxwell on the boundary if he's stayed inside the rope...A full delivery lofted down the ground towards long-on, Maxwell back-tracking towards the boundary, gets underneath it, knows his momentum is going to take him over the rope, throws the ball back inside but has his heel touched the boundary? This is very tight, the replays aren't the best angles. Third umpire says he can't see any movement of the boundary marker. This will be out.
full outside leg stump, deflects off the pad to midwicket
tries to come down the pitch, gets taken on the pad and it bobbles back to NCN
starts moving outside leg, Stoinis sees him, drops it in short outside off, Faheem flashes and misses
a slower ball, dug in, pulled in the air through square leg
full outside off, another cutter, swings and misses, goes on the second bounce to Carey
a wide yorker, he drives and gets a bottom edge into his boot which bobbles to the off side
another slower short ball, he's been hit on the helmet as he goes for the pull...the Australians immediately check on him. The stem guard has become loose
full, wide outside off, he drives and it's another inside edge into the batsman which scuttles away
terrific yorker, squeezed out through midwicket
full and straight, clubbed back down the pitch but just a single as it comes off the toe of the bat
back of a length, and launched into the stands! That's more like it from Faheem, uses his power to muscle this over long-on
finds long-on! Coulter-Nile may have got away with this, was in the slot, Faheem was eyeing up another six over long-on but could get the distance. The bat twisted in his hand
a slower short ball and he plays this well, angles it between short third man and backward point
full outside off, cracked firmly to cover on the edge of the circle
swings across the line of a full delivery and gets a thick inside edge past the stumps to short fine leg
a slower ball into the pitch, gets a bottom edge as he pulls, lobs down by his feet and they scamper through...Stoinis kicks the ball into the stumps, they check for the run out but he's fine
that's into the stands...a lovely pick-up off the pads by Imad, a cross-seamer from Stoinis which was on the wrong line
and now he finds the gap wide of mid-off! Gave himself a fraction of room, was a low full toss, driven through the in-field
another slower short ball, swatted to deep midwicket
a slower ball, short of a length, swings and misses and they don't try for the bye to the keeper
past the outside edge! Khawaja leans out at a full one that drifts away from him outside off, beating the bat
pushed across Khawaja from around the stumps, and this one is left alone
a smashing drive is stopped after a smart dive from Imam in the covers
punched firmly, but straight at mid off
beaten again! Classic Imad, drifting the ball away through the air with precious little flight, and Khawaja pokes inside it
full and straight, and he gets bat on this one, pushing it back to the bowler
he hits a length in the channel and Finch is content defending from the crease
floated fuller at 125km/h, and a Finch drive is intercepted at cover
and Finch breaks a run of eight dots with a tip-and-run single to mid on, where Malik fields and throws down the stumps with the batsman comfortably home
immediately, a boundary, with some sublime wristwork from Khawaja, who places the ball along the turf and past midwicket
and now through the covers, Khawaja walking into a fluent little drive. The ball pings out of the middle and races through the gap
Abbas straightens his line, aiming for the top of off, and Khawaja defends from the crease
still no runs off Imad, Finch stepping forward and defending it back to him
Imad snakes one in from outside off to hurry Finch's jabbing defence with a slider
Finch throws his hands into a drive, but the ball drifts in and takes the inside edge, rolling to short fine
nicely stopped by Haris Sohail at leg slip, the ball flicking the pad as it was speared down the leg side
Imad offers Finch no width whatsoever, firing one in at leg stump
finally a run off him, the ball coming off the inside half of Finch's bat and rolling into space at midwicket
Finch drives on the up to mid off, and they take the fielder on with a quick single
Khawaja confidently fetches a full one from outside off, but his shot is stopped at midwicket
Khawaja hangs his hands out outside off and chops a length ball down close in, and there's no room for a quick single as Rizwan's quickly up
Khawaja drives firmly, but straight to Malik
Khawaja skips out, looking to get after Abbas, but punts it straight to mid on. Abbas walks down to have a few words
glanced down to fine leg for a brace, and that takes Khawaja to 1,000 runs in ODIs
and yet another dot to start, his 13th, as Finch pushes a full one back at the bowler
Finch drives towards mid off and wants a run, but it's too tight

the first bad ball Imad has bowled, flung down the leg side and Finch just needs to get bat on it. And it's none other than Mohammad Hasnain who runs after it from short fine, hauling the ball in just inside the rope to save a run
but this one won't be stopped as Imad loses his line towards Khawaja's pads and is deftly glanced away
a handsome drive beats cover. It's a shot that wouldn't look out of place in the longer format, Khawaja leaning into a high-elbowed drive
flicked off the pads for a single
Khawaja walks down as Abbas loops down a slower one at 113km/h, and he finds just enough space wide of mid on for a quick single
Abbas bends his back on this one and finds some seam movement into him off a good length, beating Finch's glance. The ball bounces off the pad and goes to gully, and they find a leg bye
Khawaja whips smartly off his pads, but Imad bends low and stops it cleanly at short fine leg
there's a nice crack off the bat as Khawaja steps into another flowing drive, but this time he finds cover
wrong line from Abbas, zipping it down towards his pads, and Khawaja gets some willow on a fine glance
much better from Abbas, aiming for the top of off, and Khawaja defends
Finch nurdles off his pads and doesn't beat short fine, but Khawaja calls him through for a quick single
Khawaja drives at one drifting across him, pinging mid off
Khawaja looks for a drop and run single, but point is in too quickly
speared in full at 96.7km/h, and it's tapped down to long on
a full length draws Finch forward, but he can only push softly to cover
Imad attacks the stumps, and it's dead-batted back at him
and he hits a length outside off at 131km/h to start, Khawaja pushing to point
Khawaja waits on a late cut to find a single to third man
Finch spots some width and punches outside off, but finds point
Finch pushes at this one even more forcefully, but it's another dot as he can't get it through a packed off side field
Faheem aims full at 134km/h, and it keeps a little low but Finch keeps it out
Finch stands tall and looks to power one through cover, but yet again picks out the fielder
flicked off his toes and through midwicket
width, and it's punished! Imad had done such a good job of cramping Finch for room, but this is short and wide and Finch puts it away through point - importantly, he also placed it into the gap
this one is straighter, but he's worked through square leg to turn the strike over
Khawaja lets his wrists do the work, and finds a single to long on
tapped softly towards midwicket, and they steal a quick single before the fielder can get to it
powered through cover, the two fielders in that region just looking at the ball and then at each other as the ball flies between them and away to the rope. No-one moved
Faheem keeps it just short of a good length, Finch pressing to cover
there's a stifled appeal as the ball comes off the pad, but it's headed well down the leg side
chopped down to gully. Finch charges out at the non-striker's end, but Khawaja sends him back with a loud 'no!'
flicked softly into the leg side, where some sleepy fielding allows a run. Slight misfield from Haris Sohail
just short of Imad! Finch has struggled to penetrate the cover region, so he tries to go over it, but mis-hits his drive. It flies in the air, but dips and drops short of Imad at mid off
pushed into the off side, and again he can't beat the field
Hasnain charges in off a long run up and starts with a bristling bouncer at almost 143km/h, Khawaja's knees buckling under him as he ducks to get out of the way
rising off a length, just outside off, and Khawaja angles his bat to find a single near point
Hasnain steams in and hits a length at 146.2km/h, Finch forcing him away through point for a single
angled across Khawaja, who jabs late to find a single to third man
Hasnain finds some tail in through the air at close to 142km/h, and there's half an appeal as an inside edge bounces off Finch's pad into the leg side
Khawaja thrusts his hands out at a delivery outside off at 147.4km/h, guiding a single to third man
Khawaja drives back past the bowler, but mid on sprints around and dives to cut it off
Khawaja angles his bat and turns the strike over with a single to third man
a hint of seam movement in to Finch, who pushes to mid on
Finch doesn't bother moving his feet much, but lets his bottom hand lead the shot to power the ball up and over cover. Too full from Faheem, and there was some width
the bowler pulls his length back in response to the last shot, Finch pushing to cover
just short of a full length, outside off, and the ball comes off the inside half of the bat and rolls to midwicket
Khawaja hops and whips off his hip to find a single through square leg

testing bouncer! It seemed too quick for Finch at 146.9km/h, the ball skidding on to him and hitting him on the helmet before he was halfway into his pull. The ball hits him flush on the peak. He's fine, but he might need a new helmet out there. And there's a short delay as one is brought out to him
for the umpteenth time, Khawaja angles his bat and works it to third man
plenty of pace once again, but not enough direction as this one is fired down the leg side. Has Finch got bat on it? Looks like it's given as runs
again Finch is late on the pull as a bouncer arrives at over 146km/h, splicing the shot tamely in the air but into space on the leg side. That's definitely hurried him
and he hits a full length on off stump to finish, Khawaja watchfully seeing him off
fizzing legbreak to start, and there's some spin straight away, the ball kissing the outside edge and rolling through gully
a little too short, and he's thumped out to the cover sweeper
Khawaja stays deep and works with the spin into the leg side
some drift for Yasir, but it's slightly too full and Khawaja flicks off his toes for a single
Finch goes back and across and works a straight one through mid on
tapped back past a diving bowler, another single
flicked off his pads and through midwicket for one
ouch! Finch is almost beaten again by a short-ish ball that rushes on to his pull, taking the inside edge and striking him in the midriff
skidding in to him at 142km/h, and Finch's glance is stopped at square leg
rising off a length at 141.6km/h, but there's a little width for Finch to work with and a he finds a single to the sweeper

nippy bouncer at 141km/h, Khawaja ducking quickly under it. Hasnain wanders down after following through to eye-ball the batsman. It wasn't actually all that short, and not called a bouncer by the umpire
on a length and straight at 142.4km/h, Khawaja pushing to cover

biffed over long on! There's a fielder in place down there, but Finch takes him on with a thump down the ground. He hits it hard, and not too high but far enough to beat a leaping fielder at the boundary's edge
ripping off a good, full length, Finch defending to cover
too short this time, and Finch hangs back to place a shot out to the sweeper
Khawaja skips out to get close to a legbreak, working with the spin to find a single to short fine leg
slider on off stump. Finch backs away and exposes his stumps, but puts bat to ball to find another single through cover
beaten outside off by one that just zips straight across him
slugged wide of mid on, Finch seizing on one that's pitched up to him and muscling it into - and through - the leg side
dug in short, the ball loops over a ducking batsman but it's not stopped cleanly behind the stumps
worked off the pads down to fine leg
pitched up outside off, and Hasnain finds a hint of shape in through the air, but Finch likes it in his half and he just swings through the line to send it straight back where it came from
Hasnain reverts to the bouncer at 143km/h, but Finch is expecting this one, waiting on the back foot to pull into the leg side
Khawaja shuffles and edges a pull onto his thigh, but there's no harm done
pushes a good-length delivery to cover
goes back to a shorter ball and plays down to long-off
gets across his stumps and tucks a straight delivery to deep square
this skids through a touch and Finch is on the back foot, but he's able to drive out to deep cover
flicked off the stumps straight of midwicket
fuller, clubbed down to long-on
round the wicket, on a length at off stump, pushed to cover
uses his feet and crunches this straight down the ground, handsome way for Finch to reach his fifty. Also the century stand
driven along the ground to long-off
round the wicket, misses his flick to the leg side and it takes the pad
pushed square into the off side
uses his feet again, takes this from outside off to midwicket
driven off the back foot to cover
full outside leg, swept behind square, was in the air for a little while
dragged down short outside off, driven off the back foot and placed excellently wide of long-off
that's huge, onto the roof...Finch opens his shoulders, launches it straight down the ground. Didn't use his feet, stayed in the crease, just swung through the line
full, gets forward and defends
and now he goes over the leg side, that's an even better shot, an effortless pick-up off his pads which has sailed into the stands at deep midwicket. What a difference a few weeks makes
round the wicket, pushed across and beats the outside edge as Khawaja is a little lazy with his push
bottom hand takes over this time and he drags it down to long-on
angled into the pads, he can't get it away
full at middle and leg, plays forward and it runs off an inside edge to midwicket
pushes a full delivery back to the bowler
short outside off, cracked down to long-off
round the wicket, fired down the leg side
that's a heave, but an effective heave, runs to the midwicket rope despite coming off not much more than a think inside edge as he went for a big drive
dabbed from outside off to short third man
opens the face and places in front of point
round the wicket, whipped off the pads to deep square and that's another fifty for Khawaja
full at the stumps, defended
that's miles back over long on...again he stayed in the crease, just freed his arms and lofted a full delivery into the second tier
round the wicket, flicked through midwicket
tapped off the pads into midwicket
strides forward, driven to deep cover
goes back in the crease and flicks this off the stumps to deep square leg
flicked from outside off square into the leg side
this one gripped a little, straighten on Finch and squared him up as he aimed to the leg side
angled across outside off, opens the face and runs it to third man
worked off the stumps to long leg
short outside off, driven from the back foot to deep cover
just over the bowler's head as Khawaja gets a leading edge looking to work this through midwicket, turned the bat face early
short of a length outside, punched to deep cover
driven square to deep point off the back foot
full at off stump, driven firmly to cover
a flatter delivery, outside off, defended
dragged down short, Khawaja rocks back and pulls it sweetly through square leg...excellent placement
fuller, pushed back to the bowler
gets across to off stump and plays a bottom-handed whip to long-on
plays forward and nudges to midwicket

round the wicket, short of a length, Khawaja gets inside the line and flicks it fine of long leg...Yasir Shah races around, dives and tries to flick it back. And, actually, the third umpire rules he just kept it in
gets beaten as this bounces a touch more from back of a length, climbs over the top edge as he aims to drive
back of a length outside off, played into backward point
moves across the crease again, whips it from outside off through square leg, lovely timing, and Shan Masood does very well in the deep to prevent the boundary
back of a length outside off, defended to point
driven off the back foot to cover
full at off stump, 143kph, defended to the off side
back of a length at middle and off, 143kph, pushed towards mid-off...jarring the splice
fuller, at the stumps, hint of shape in at the batsman, played to the covers. Impressive stuff
through him with a short one again as Finch is caught in a tangle as he thinks about pulling, ends up awkwardly getting out of the line
full outside off, 144kph, driven just to the left of mid-off for a sharp single
a bouncer over leg stump, Khawaja lets it over his back. Excellent comeback over
short outside off, slides off the face down to third man as he drives from the back foot
round the wicket, short of a length, pulled off one leg just in front of square, but good work by Masood on the boundary to flick it back
flicks a length delivery from outside off to deep midwicket
short outside off, pulled well in front of square as that sat up nicely
round the wicket, full outside off, driven to mid-on with a closed bat face
gets forward into a length ball and punches to cover
good length at off stump, pushed to the covers
back of a length outside off, touch of shape away, played to point off the back foot
rolls his wrists over a short ball and places this superbly behind square...into the 90s
played out into the deep on the off side
full outside off, whipped wide of mid-on, they look for the second but decline
short outside off, dabbed down to third man, Imad dives to keep it in
round the wicket, full outside off, Khawaja walks at the bowler then flicks to deep square leg
full at the stumps, pushed towards mid-on
terrific placement, worked off the stumps behind square, Faheem slides around the boundary and does well to cut it off
pushes a length delivery to mid-off
sweetly struck off the back foot to the cover sweeper
full, angled in at off stump, tickled to the leg side off the inside half of the bat
round the wicket, short, pushed well down the leg side
full outside off, angled past backward point to third man
good length on off stump, 130kph, defended to backward point
short of a length, pulled/swatted to deep square
good length outside off, pushed easily into the gap at cover
back-to-back hundreds for the captain as he clips a full delivery off his toes through midwicket. Lets our a roar, helmet comes off. He's certainly back to his best
a short delivery, 144kph, defended on the back foot
over the wicket, back of a length, chopped to third man
length ball outside off, driven to cover
shapes into the pads, deflects backward of square
more whippage from Khawaja as he takes this from outside off stump to deep square
back of a length, just outside off, driven from the back foot to mid-off
fuller, at the stumps, clipped to midwicket
full outside leg, goes for the sweep and it comes off the pad
brings out the reverse sweep, finds short third man
tries it again, another reverse, think this one comes off the bottom edge
back to something conventional, works a straight delivery to deep midwicket
plays back and drives to cover...then there's a wild throw which gives away four runs! Umar Akmal the culprit with an awful return past Rizwan
off the back foot past the bowler to long-off
clips a straight delivery wide of a diving midwicket
round the wicket, full and straight, clipped to deep midwicket
back of a length, into the pads, rebounds towards square leg
a short ball from round wicket, Khawaja was walking down the pitch and let to go over his back
full, speared down the leg side, bowl that again
short outside off, he does really well to get over the top of this and pull it backward of square...brings up the 200 stand
back of a length outside off, runs it down to third man to keep the strike
flicked to square leg
finds the gap into the deep this time off the pads
full at the stumps, defended
tossed up, plenty of air, a stinging straight drive just wide of Yasir who was probably pleased he couldn't get a hand on it
reverse sweeps and picks out short third man
uses his feet and works out to deep midwicket
Khawaja misses a whip into the leg side, but they find a leg bye
Khawaja walks into a drive, pushing it on the up past point
Finch drives, but finds mid off
full, and seaming in to Finch, who works it fine on the leg side
this one keeps a little low, but Khawaja spots it and flicks into the leg side
beaten on the outside edge by a back-of-the-hand variation
floated up, Khawaja can't get it away
and now he falls! Khawaja was itching to get after Yasir, but he's picked out Imam at deep midwicket and finally this mammoth, record-setting opening stand is broken
Yasir attacks the stumps but Maxwell is forward to keep it out
full and straight, and it's poked defensively to extra cover
drifting in to Finch, who punches down the ground
speared in full, from around the stumps, Maxwell placing a drive out to deep extra
drifting in mischievously, but Finch reads it and finds a quick single to cover
this one's held back a touch, Maxwell's drive being aimed at the cover fielder
full and wide, tempting Maxwell into a flashy square drive that brings only a single to the sweeper
this keeps very low as it comes in with the arm, but Finch's bat is down in time and he keeps the strike with a single to long off
whipped off the pads, but straight to short fine leg
sliding on towards the stumps, but Finch is back and across to work it into the leg side
Maxwell sweeps, but doesn't get much on it and there's only a single to be had to short fine
chopped off the stumps and back to the bowler
speared down at middle and off, Finch pushing it back to the bowler
Finch ruins a tight over, his eyes lighting up at a flighted delivery just outside off. A powerful drive bursts straight back over Yasir and away for four
an in-drifter squirts off the inside edge, rolling to short fine leg
punched off the back foot, but straight to cover
speared down the leg side to add to the extras column
slammed high over long on! Maxwell's had a look, now he has a go. He backs away to leg and then heaves mightily over the leg side for a maximum
another bottom-handed thump from Maxwell, and it goes on the bounce out to Imad at long on
drifting down the leg side, and it comes off the pad and rolls fine
HUGE! Maxwell ends the over with a massive swipe down the ground. He gets an excellent connection, and sends the ball onto the roof of the grandstand
sliding on straight, and Finch picks it to find a single behind square on the leg side
pushed through flat on off stump by Yasir, Maxwell flicking into the leg side and rushing back for a second to take the required runs under 50
not much turn, but a bit of extra bounce for Yasir and Maxwell is taken a little by surprise
a touch too short, and he's slapped out to the cover sweeper
pushed defensively to cover
worked off the toes, and they push the fielder for a quick single
a length ball comes off the inside half of a poke outside off, rolling into space on the leg side

direct hit, and Maxwell walks off straight away, even as the umpire sends it upstairs. He pushed to mid off and set off for what would have been a tight single, had the throw not been deadly accurate to find him short. He just hit it and set off, but Haris Sohail's throw was sharp and on target. Replays simply confirm his demise
pushed through the gap at extra cover for one
Marsh works off his pads, but finds the field
Faheem stays tight on off stump, and Marsh can't get off the mark just yet
but now he is, angling his bat to find a single to third man
beaten in the flight, but Rizwan can't stop it cleanly either and they pinch a bye. Two, in fact
turned with the spin into the leg side
Yasir goes wide on the crease from around the stumps, Marsh defending into the leg side with the spin
floated up outside off, Marsh threads a drive through cover and they're back for the second
punched down to long on for one
Finch drives down the ground, and he'll keep the strike
punched into the cover field, but he can't break through
worked into the gap on the leg side for a single
Marsh is a little squared up by one that goes across him, but keeps it out well enough
Marsh pulls, though it's not that short, and his shot is stopped at midwicket
chopped down close in, in front of point, and they hurry through for a quick single
tight end to the over from Faheem, who once again finds some seam movement in to cramp Finch for room
beaten outside off by one that holds its line, good start
full and wide at 142km/h and Marsh flays it uppishly through point. Shan Masood dives in the deep to save runs
pushed down towards his legs, and they find a single off the pad
beaten on the back foot outside off stump. Finch just swished inside it, and he's upset with himself
Hasnain targets the stumps at almost 139km/h, Finch finding a single with a bottom-handed push into the leg side

direct hit would have had him! Marsh taps to point and sets off. Finch sends him back, but he's slow to turn, and had the throw been accurate, he would have been out. Tough chance, just the one stump to aim at for Imam
seaming in off a length, and Finch can't get it past midwicket

chipped uppishly into the leg side, and again midwicket cuts it off but they take him on for a quick single. The throw goes wide. And was possibly to the wrong end, as Marsh had hesitated setting off from the other end. A better throw could have made things interesting
Marsh pulls, but it doesn't come onto the bat and he can't beat the infield

in the air, but safe! Marsh looks to pull in the air, but it rushes on to him and loops off the splice ... but falls safely at mid on! If long on had been up, that would have been the simplest of catches

just short of Yasir in the deep! Finch goes on the attack now, lifting a length ball over the leg side. He doesn't connect well, but that actually saves him as Yasir can't get in off the midwicket boundary in time to catch it - though he stops the boundary
pushed down to long on, just the one
well bowled! Hasnain slings down a quick yorker at the toes, Finch hurrying to keep it out. That just tailed in through the air as well ...
short, and it's pulled just wide of mid on. Haris Sohail is in position there, and he has a shy but misses. There have been a few nervy runs in the last few minutes
this will help! Finch picks up the length early, getting under the ball to swat it in the air and over the leg side boundary
another reverse swinging yorker at 144.6km/h, but it's dug out down the ground for a single
Marsh is forward and slaps a fluid drive out to the sweeper after Hasnain aims full

pitched right up at a shade over 145km/h, and Finch drives straight to cover. They take on Haris Sohail in the position for a single, and Finch wasn't even in the frame as the throw came in ... but again it goes wide!
spanked straight back down the ground, and Finch equals his highest score in ODI cricket
150 up for Aaron Finch! He gets there from 141 deliveries, flicking the ball sweetly through square leg. Back to back tons, and a career best
pushed through mid on, just the one
tip-and-run single, Marsh dead-batting it close on the off side and Finch calling him through
Finch misses his flick, but the ball pings off his pad and rolls to fine leg. They're back for the second, and that's the game!
